python.code: """ This is to show simple COVID19 info fetching from worldometers site using lxml * The main motivation to use lxml in place of bs4 is that it is faster and therefore more convenient to use in Python web projects (e.g. Django or Flask-based) """ from collections import namedtuple import requests from lxml import html # type: ignore covid_data = namedtuple("covid_data", "cases deaths recovered") def covid_stats(url: str = "https://www.worldometers.info/coronavirus/") -> covid_data: xpath_str = '//div[@class = "maincounter-number"]/span/text()' return covid_data(*html.fromstring(requests.get(url).content).xpath(xpath_str)) fmt = """Total COVID-19 cases in the world: {} Total deaths due to COVID-19 in the world: {} Total COVID-19 patients recovered in the world: {}""" print(fmt.format(*covid_stats()))
